CPI.AT.summary: CPI Computer Peripherals International provides IT products and services in Greece. The company offers printers for business applications; barcode/RF-ID printers and scanners, and hand-held portables; scanners and digitization products; surveillance and security products; projectors and specialized products for the education sector; POS terminals and peripherals for tourism, and food and retail businesses; and interactive systems. It also provides CPI product technical support, digitization and document management, and print management services, as well as install, move, add, and change services for computer equipment; technical support services for third-party manufacturers; and custom, consultation, and infrastructure services. The company was founded in 1990 and is based in Athens, Greece.

EPSIL.AT.summary: Epsilon Net S.A. operates in the areas of information technology in Greece. The company offers software solutions for taxation, accounting, and payroll and human resource management, as well as applications for commercial, retail, customer relations management, restaurant, hospitality, and services sectors. It also provides specialized training services to business executives and professionals through various professional training programs; custom business training; and operates e-forologia, a networking portal that addresses businesses and professionals of financial field. In addition, the company offers online search engine services; Tax e-Calendar, a networking tool of tax and labor tasks management; Komvos, a network of solutions to tax issues; Epsilon 7 magazine; and tax/accounting e-magazine. Epsilon Net S.A. was founded in 1999 and is based in Thessaloniki, Greece.

FORTH.AT.long_name: Hellenic Company for Telecommunications and Telematic Applications S.A.
FORTH.AT.summary: Hellenic Company for Telecommunications and Telematic Applications S.A., together with its subsidiaries, provides telecommunications and pay-TV services to small and medium-sized enterprises, and private consumers in Greece. It offers Internet services, such as Internet access, Internet leased lines, data connectivity services, LMDS, etc., as well as fixed telephony and data services. The company also provides digital radio-television and/or audiovisual services; owns and broadcasts the Novasports channels; and offers content acquisition and customer support services, as well as provides satellite services. Hellenic Company for Telecommunications and Telematic Applications S.A. was incorporated in 1995 and is headquartered in Pallini, Greece.

HTO.AT.summary: Hellenic Telecommunications Organization S.A., together with its subsidiaries, provides telecommunications and related services to businesses and individuals primarily in Greece and Romania. It operates through OTE, COSMOTE Group, TELEKOM ROMANIA, and Other segments. The company offers fixed-line, Internet access, and ICT services; and international carrier and TV production services. It also provides mobile and satellite telecommunication, electronic money, e-commerce, financing, consultancy and security, real estate, insurance brokerage, training, wholesale telephony, retail, marketing, overdue accounts management, wholesale broadband, and infrastructure services. The company was founded in 1949 and is based in Athens, Greece.

ILYDA.AT.summary: Ilyda SA engages in software development business in Greece. It offers enterprise resource planning systems, such as MegaTron ERP and Kinitron Smart ERP; Dioscourides Smart, Dioscourides XPress, and Dioscourides ERP Retail System for pharmacies; MegaTron Pharma ERP for drugstores; and LIS Bio-Diagnosis for microbiological laboratories. The company also provides MegaTron DEVA for water supply/sewerage companies; PSIS Financial Management for public sector companies; PSIS Payroll & Personnel Management for legal entities; and SIS Secretariats of Educational Institutions for educational institutions. In addition, it provides software support services, such as telephone support, remote support, on-site support, and feedback support services; project design and implementation; and software training services. The company was founded in 1992 and is headquartered in Athens, Greece.

INTEK.AT.summary: IDEAL Group S.A. distributes white electrical appliances, information technology products, and lighting products in Greece. It offers home appliances, including cookers, refrigerators, washing machines, hoods, freezers, kitchen appliances, dishwashers, washing machines, washer-dryers, dryers, microwave ovens, refrigerators, and TVs. The company also provides information technology products comprising laptops, tablets, hard drives, and security products; batteries; professional and domestic lighting; and B2B products, such as application security, disaster recovery and encryption, endpoint security, network access, network security, systems management and reporting, and unified communications products, as well as call centers and other telecommunications equipment, and network management equipment. In addition, it offers customer communication management software; i-DOCS, a business application, which manages transactional database; and digital security services. The company offers its products under the Toshiba, Liebherr, Fourlis, KÃ¶rting, TurboAir, Brandt, Alcatel-Lucent Enterprise, Fortinet, ESET, Kaspersky Lab, Trend Micro, ZTE, and Allot Communications brands. The company was formerly known as Ideal Standard Refractories S.A. and changed its name to IDEAL Group S.A. in 1991. IDEAL Group S.A. was founded in 1972 and is headquartered in Athens, Greece.

INTET.AT.summary: Intertech S.A. Inter. Technologies distributes technology products in Greece. It operates as a distributor of various brands, such as Panasonic, iLuv, Ricoh, Gestetner, and Satellite. The company was founded in 1988 and is based in Elliniko, Greece. Intertech S.A. Inter. Technologies was formerly a subsidiary of Demco Group.

INTRK.AT.summary: Intracom Holdings S.A. operates as an IT solutions and services company. The company offers consulting, implementing, outsourcing, communication, and integration services to public, banking, telecommunication, transportation, and healthcare industries, as well as EU institutions. It also engages in the civil engineering, infrastructure, telecom network, renewable energy, and environmental construction, as well as real estate development activities. In addition, the company offers defense and security communication products comprising wideband radios, intercommunication systems, and satellite communication products; data link, telemetry devices, and cryptographic equipment, and as well as terminal and radio accessories; hybrid power stations, generator fuel saving systems, and energy storage systems; and turn-key homeland security solutions. Further, it operates a 21MW wind farm. Intracom Holdings S.A. was founded in 1977 and is based in Paiania, Greece.

LEBEK.AT.summary: N. Leventeris S.A. manufactures and sells wires and wire ropes in Greece. The company offers steel wires, steel wire ropes, combination ropes, fiber and mooring ropes, wire rope slings, chains, anchors, fiber slings, crosby products, and agricultural wire ropes, as well as accessories comprising hooks, turnbuckles, shackles, and wire rope thimbles. It also provides spring wires; synthetic and natural fiber ropes; clips; fenders; and special wire ropes for marine, fishing, elevator, hoist, overhead crane, crane, excavator, mine, quarry, and cultivation industries. The company was founded in 1948 and is headquartered in Piraeus, Greece.

LEBEP.AT.summary: N. Leventeris S.A. manufactures and sells wires and wire ropes in Greece. The company offers steel wires, steel wire ropes, combination ropes, fiber and mooring ropes, wire rope slings, chains, anchors, fiber slings, crosby products, and agricultural wire ropes, as well as accessories comprising hooks, turnbuckles, shackles, and wire rope thimbles. It also provides spring wires; synthetic and natural fiber ropes; clips; fenders; and special wire ropes for marine, fishing, elevator, hoist, overhead crane, crane, excavator, mine, quarry, and cultivation industries. The company was founded in 1948 and is headquartered in Piraeus, Greece.

MEDIC.AT.summary: Medicon Hellas S.A. operates in the diagnostics industry. The company offers instruments, tests, and procedures for public and private hospitals, primary care centers, diagnostic centers, and private laboratories in Greece and internationally. The company imports and distributes analytical workstations for chemistry, immunochemistry and hematology labs, intensive care units, and point-of-care systems under the MLR name. It also produces instrument-specific and barcoded vial reagents for various analyzers, such as specific protein and hematology, as well as clinical chemistry comprising control and calibration, and test. In addition, the company engages in the production of cosmetic and skin care products under the Miss Beaute brand name. Further, it develops and sells software for laboratory and medical applications; supplies IT systems to healthcare providers; and produces monoclonal and polyclonal antibodies as raw materials. Additionally, the company remanufactures and resells chemistry, hematology, blood gas, and immunochemistry analyzers; and provides contract remanufacturing and diagnostics laboratory services. It sells its products through supermarket chains and sales outlets. Medicon Hellas S.A. was founded in 1978 and is headquartered in Gerakas, Greece.

NRST.MI.summary: Neurosoft Software Production S.A., a software production and ICT company, design, develops, customizes, and maintains integrated software systems in the areas of Fintech and analytics, systems engineering, and cyber security operations in Greece and internationally. The company offers Consensus For Invoice Reconciliation Management (ConFIRM), a platform that targets to alleviate all issues that accounting office's face in the process of invoice reconciliation; Proxima+, an E2E factoring and supply chain finance platform, which manages firms' receivables finance business; Angel, a cyber-security solution for maritime that addresses the cyber threat; and Illicium, a cyber-deception platform. It also provides Neutrify, a security operations center, monitors and analyzes activity on networks, servers, endpoints, databases, applications, websites, and other systems and looks for anomalous activity, as well as offers advanced forensic analysis, and malware reverse engineering to analyze incidents; RedyOps, which assists in evaluating the security of organization and helps to defend from attacks combining targets such as people, technology, and physical security; and Enterprise Link, a business connectivity service. Neurosoft Software Production S.A. was founded in 1994 and is headquartered in Athens, Greece.

P8C.SG.summary: Plaisio Computers S.A., together with its subsidiaries, assembles and trades in PCs, telecommunication and office equipment, and domestic appliances in Greece and Bulgaria. It offers desktops, operating systems, laptops, tablets and accessories, peripherals, and data saving devices, as well as services of installation, demonstration, upgrade and repair of PC, etc.; televisions, home cinemas, projectors, TV accessories, and others; cameras and relative accessories, consoles, drones, etc.; and mobile phones, smartphones, accessories, wearables, land phones, fax, etc. The company also provides stationery products, such as calendars, accounting forms, organization of office and storage goods, school bags, design materials and drawing papers, and others; and printing products, which include printers, scanners, photocopiers, multi-machines, consumables, printing papers, etc. In addition, it offers office and visitor chairs, as well as drawing, office, locker, library, and filing and decoration equipment; and classic toys, board games, creative and educational toys, stem, robots, etc. Further, the company provides cookers, ovens, fridges and freezers, dishwashers, coffee machines, cookware, and kitchenware; ironing and laundry products; heaters, air-conditioners, dehumidifier, and fans; and men's and women's grooming products. It serves individuals, as well as B2B customers, including freelancers, small and medium companies, big companies, and the public sector. The company sells its products through a network of stores, department for B2B customers, catalogues, and an Internet-e-store. Plaisio Computers S.A. was founded in 1969 and is headquartered in Magoula, Greece.

PLAIS.AT.summary: Plaisio Computers S.A., together with its subsidiaries, assembles and trades in PCs, telecommunication and office equipment, and domestic appliances in Greece and Bulgaria. It offers desktops, operating systems, laptops, tablets and accessories, peripherals, and data saving devices, as well as services of installation, demonstration, upgrade and repair of PC, etc.; televisions, home cinemas, projectors, TV accessories, and others; cameras and relative accessories, consoles, drones, etc.; and mobile phones, smartphones, accessories, wearables, land phones, fax, etc. The company also provides stationery products, such as calendars, accounting forms, organization of office and storage goods, school bags, design materials and drawing papers, and others; and printing products, which include printers, scanners, photocopiers, multi-machines, consumables, printing papers, etc. In addition, it offers office and visitor chairs, as well as drawing, office, locker, library, and filing and decoration equipment; and classic toys, board games, creative and educational toys, stem, robots, etc. Further, the company provides cookers, ovens, fridges and freezers, dishwashers, coffee machines, cookware, and kitchenware; ironing and laundry products; heaters, air-conditioners, dehumidifier, and fans; and men's and women's grooming products. It serves individuals, as well as B2B customers, including freelancers, small and medium companies, big companies, and the public sector. The company sells its products through a network of stores, department for B2B customers, catalogues, and an Internet-e-store. Plaisio Computers S.A. was founded in 1969 and is headquartered in Magoula, Greece.

QUEST.AT.summary: Quest Holdings S.A., together with its subsidiaries, engages distribution of information technology and telecommunications products. The company operates in five segments: Information Technology; Information Technology Services; Courier Services; Production of Electric Power from Renewable Sources; and Financial Transactions. It distributes ICT products and cloud services, and Apple products, and related software and peripherals; operates an online store, you.gr, which provides technology products, consumer electronics, small/large domestic appliances, daily care products, and household and baby care products for consumers and professionals; and operates Apple products retail store. The company also provides integrated ICT solutions; electronic transactions management solutions; and courier and postal services. In addition, it is involved in the production of electric power from renewable sources. The company offers its products and services in Greece, Romania, Cyprus, Belgium, Italy, and Luxembourg. Quest Holdings S.A. was founded in 1981 and is based in Athens, Greece.

VIDAVO.AT.summary: Vidavo S.A. designs, develops, and provides connected health, wellness, and healthy ageing solutions. The company offers Vida24, a cloud based platform and customizable app that synchs multi-source data. Its platform provides chronic disease management, doctor on demand, nutrition management, e-health and wellness, marine telemedicine, behavioral change, insurance, personal development, scientific wellness, and digital therapeutic solutions. The company was founded in 2002 and is headquartered in Thessaloniki, Greece.
